DOCNAME: CASE OF H.G. AND G.B. v. AUSTRIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 14+8;Not necessary to examine Art. 8;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses award - domestic proceedings;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . On DATE the Innsbruck ORG ( PERSON ) ordered the first applicant 's detention on remand on suspicion of having committed homosexual acts with adolescents contrary to LAW .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG convicted the first applicant under LAW and sentenced him to DATE imprisonment . It found that , from DATE until his arrest , the first applicant had had sexual relations with CARDINAL different male minors born in DATE and DATE respectively . In determining the sentence the court had regard to the first applicant 's confession as a mitigating circumstance and to his previous convictions as aggravating circumstance .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant started to serve his sentence of imprisonment at ORG prison . On DATE the first applicant was granted early release from detention .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG convicted the second applicant under LAW and sentenced him to DATE imprisonment , suspended for a probation period of DATE . It found that on DATE the second applicant had had a sexual encounter with a male minor born in DATE . Referring to LAW the court found that the conditions for an extraordinary mitigation of sentence ( ausserordentliche PERSON 's guilt .
CARDINAL . On DATE the second applicant appealed , arguing , inter alia , that LAW was unconstitutional in that it did not comply with LAW CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the second applicant 's appeal . The ORG stated that it had no doubts about the constitutionality of LAW and referred in this respect to ORG case - law .
CARDINAL . Any sexual acts with persons DATE are punishable under ORG CARDINAL and CARDINAL of LAW .
Article CARDINAL of LAW , in the version in force at the material time , read as follows :
“ A male person who after attaining DATE fornicates with a person of the same sex who has attained the age of DATE but not the age of CARDINAL shall be sentenced to imprisonment for DATE . ”
CARDINAL . On DATE , upon a request for review made by ORG , ORG found that LAW was unconstitutional .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG decided to repeal LAW . That amendment , published in ORG ( ORG ) no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , came into force on DATE .

CARDINAL . The ORG notes that the legal situation has remained unchanged since DATE , when it gave its PERSON and PERSON v. GPE judgment ( nos . CARDINAL and CARDINAL , ORG CARDINAL-I ) . For a more detailed description of the law , ORG judgments concerning LAW and the parliamentary debate relating to the issue , it therefore refers to the said judgment ( § § DATE ) .
